com.here.sdk.mapview

Class LocationIndicator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.NativeBase
      • com.here.sdk.mapview.LocationIndicator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MapViewLifecycleListener

    public final class LocationIndicator
extends NativeBase
implements MapViewLifecycleListener

    Graphical object to represent the location of the user on a MapView. It is either as a green dot for pedestrian style or a triangular arrow for vehicle navigation style. The location is made available to an instance of this class by calling the method LocationIndicator.updateLocation(com.here.sdk.core.Location). Use the method MapViewBase.addLifecycleListener(com.here.sdk.mapview.MapViewLifecycleListener) to add this object to the map and MapViewBase.removeLifecycleListener(com.here.sdk.mapview.MapViewLifecycleListener) to remove it. Take care that the location indicator is not accidentally added to the map view multiple times for example when the android activity is recreated after an orientation change.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  LocationIndicator.IndicatorStyle
      The predefined styles for the location indicator which are pedestrian and navigation mode.
      static class  LocationIndicator.MarkerType
      Enum to identify different types of markers of the location indicator.

      Returns true if the indicator is in active state and false for inactive state.

    • Method Detail

      • updateLocation

        public void updateLocation(@NonNull
                           Location location)

        Updates the indicator to a new location.

        Parameters:
        location -

      • setMarker3dModel

        public void setMarker3dModel(@NonNull
                             MapMarker3DModel model,
                             double scale,
                             @NonNull
                             LocationIndicator.MarkerType type)

        Sets the MapMarker3DModel asset to be displayed as location indicator for a specified type. The 3D model should be oriented with y axis up and thus standing on the x/z plane where the z axis is the depth. The direction in which the location indicator is pointing is the positive z axis.

        Parameters:
        model -
        scale -
        type -

      • getLocationIndicatorStyle

        @NonNull
public LocationIndicator.IndicatorStyle getLocationIndicatorStyle()

        Returns the LocationIndicator.IndicatorStyle which can be LocationIndicator.IndicatorStyle.PEDESTRIAN or LocationIndicator.IndicatorStyle.NAVIGATION.

      • setLocationIndicatorStyle

        public void setLocationIndicatorStyle(@NonNull
                                      LocationIndicator.IndicatorStyle value)

        Sets LocationIndicator.getLocationIndicatorStyle() to LocationIndicator.IndicatorStyle.PEDESTRIAN or LocationIndicator.IndicatorStyle.NAVIGATION.

        Parameters:
        value -

        This property defines which predefined style the location indicator uses. By default the style is LocationIndicator.IndicatorStyle.PEDESTRIAN.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()

        Returns true if the indicator is in active state and false for inactive state.

      • setActive

        public void setActive(boolean value)

        Sets the indicator to active state if true was passed or to inactive state when false was passed.

        Parameters:
        value -

        Determines the active state. Set to false to show the inactive version of the indicator which is typically represented by a grayed out version of the indicator. This can be used in case the location of the indicator might be outdated or positioning on the device is disabled. Defaults to true.

      • onAttach

        public void onAttach(@NonNull
                     MapViewBase mapView)

        Called when adding MapViewLifecycleListener to the map view. Can be used to implement the logic to create and add visual components to the map view.

        paramcom.here.sdk.mapview.MapViewLifecycleListener#onAttach#mapView The map view to attach to.

        Specified by:

      • onDetach

        public void onDetach(@NonNull
                     MapViewBase mapView)

        Called when removing MapViewLifecycleListener from the map view. Can be used to implement the logic to remove visual components from the map view and release resources if necessary.

        paramcom.here.sdk.mapview.MapViewLifecycleListener#onDetach#mapView The map view to detach from.

        Specified by:
        onDetach in interface MapViewLifecycleListener
        Parameters:
        mapView -

      • onPause

        public void onPause()

        Called when the map view to which this MapViewLifecycleListener is attached to gets paused (usually when the app goes into background). This should be used by components that perform continuous updates to pause those updates until MapViewLifecycleListener.onResume() is called.

        Specified by:
        onPause in interface MapViewLifecycleListener

      • onResume

        public void onResume()

        Called when the map view to which this MapViewLifecycleListener is attached to gets resumed (usually when the app goes into foreground). This should be used by components that perform continuous updates to resume those updates after a previous call to MapViewLifecycleListener.onPause().

        Specified by:
        onResume in interface MapViewLifecycleListener

      • onDestroy

        public void onDestroy()

        Called when the map view to which this is attached to is destroyed. After this is called, no other MapViewLifecycleListener method will be invoked. This should be used to make sure all resources are freed.

        Specified by:
        onDestroy in interface MapViewLifecycleListener
